Articles.Content:
I'm not sure if this has been done before but I'm looking for a small Eve return vessel to get some Kerbals off of the planet. You see I set up a colony in a previous version of the game and now in version 1.0 the rules of the universe have changed and none of the return vehicles work any more. I've ported the save file to version 1.0 - [you can download it here](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/4us3z6uekxplyu5/AADbyRlfD7vSdPAbWPpLmmOMa?dl=0) to see what I'm up against (it's a sandbox game). So I guess my question is: **What is the smallest craft that you can get into orbit from the surface of Eve with one Kerbal on board?**

![E3aYnRk.png](http://i.imgur.com/E3aYnRk.png)

All I need is a craft that can drop down from Eve orbit to the surface and return back into Eve orbit with at least one Kerbal on board. It doesn't need to be an SSTO, just something small and compact. My poor Kerbals are going stir crazy and want to get home!

![03Y3vnF.png](http://i.imgur.com/03Y3vnF.png)

JR

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T22:01:52Z" title="08/13/2015 10:01  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Jolly\_Roger**

[Foxster](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125127-EZ-Eve?highlight=Foxster) has some pretty small ones, actually [this one](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120556-Eve-Bootstrap-lander-and-lifter-%281-0-2%29) is a lot smaller, you could use [mine](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123380-SMA-Bare-Minimum-Superseded-Prototype-Eve-Lander-and-Return-Vehicle?p=1977728#post1977728), but it needs tweaking

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T23:13:00Z" title="08/13/2015 11:13  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by selfish\_meme**
This exchange of spacecraft has been moved to the Spacecraft Exchange.

This is the lightest one I managed to build. 90 tonnes or so at atmospheric entry, 60 something at take off. Unfortunately I no longer have the craft file, but you can see how it's built.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aAwl50CD5kY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I wonder how my pre 1.0 EVE sea lvl 4 seats lifting craft doing in 1.0. Anyone care to test it out for me?

> 
> I wonder how my pre 1.0 EVE sea lvl 4 seats lifting craft doing in 1.0. Anyone care to test it out for me?

I remember it, I am not sure it will work properly. Are you seriously interested in a test?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-14T10:49:50Z" title="08/14/2015 10:49  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 14, 2015</time> by Signo**

Nothing that I have works on Eve any more but I'm willing to test designs if you have a craft file.

JR

I think this was my favorite...

![DAzpYkZ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DAzpYkZ.jpg)

Craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/wx8jjlhg4cnmbiy/Eve%20new%208.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/wx8jjlhg4cnmbiy/Eve%20new%208.craft?dl=0)

Please test for me... thanks in advanced.

[Http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60331-Eve-Misison-Report-Live-update-with-persistent-file-along-the-way](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60331-Eve-Misison-Report-Live-update-with-persistent-file-along-the-way)

EVE 9. Just load and launch.

Picking through the photos I think I found your Eve9 lifter. I'm pretty sure that's not going to do the job now. The problem is drag. You can have all the dV you like but with Eve's thick and deep atmosphere you will lose all the dV fighting your way up. Your craft now has to be thin and tall, or at least made of a few thin and tall stages, all topped (and preferably bottomed too) with nosecones.

I tried it and it needs a redesign. It does not take off anymore.

A few pics of the try below.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/WCd2E)

You need to get back to play, things are a lot different now. Your designs were usually amazing and ultrasmart, with the new aero you might have a lot of fun.

I've tried a couple of times and unfortunately the drag from the heavy atmosphere will stop any craft from reaching orbit unless it is very aerodynamic (also my base is nearly at sea-level). I think I'll test out Foxter's design next - I always like to make some changes to craft I download, hope you don't mind. I sort of need ladders so I can get the Kerbal on board...

JR

Dunno if you are into Mechjeb but if so then this will help you get to orbit on Eve, otherwise it still might give an idea for how to get outa the atmos...

![CbnoF9y.png](http://i.imgur.com/CbnoF9y.png)

> 
> I've tried a couple of times and unfortunately the drag from the heavy atmosphere will stop any craft from reaching orbit unless it is very aerodynamic (also my base is nearly at sea-level). I think I'll test out Foxter's design next - I always like to make some changes to craft I download, hope you don't mind. I sort of need ladders so I can get the Kerbal on board...
> JR

Just put a lander can on the bottom and transfer, you can leave the can on Eve when you take off.

> 
> Just put a lander can on the bottom and transfer, you can leave the can on Eve when you take off.

Good idea that would work, I can jettison it along with the landing gear. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

JR
Thanks signo and JR. Very much appreciate your testing.
The words "small" and "Eve return vessel" cannot be combined in the same sentence.

> 
> The words "small" and "Eve return vessel" cannot be combined in the same sentence.

They can now, it's only 4000m/s

> 
> They can now, it's only 4000m/s

On Eve the problem is not the delta-V it's the aerodynamic drag.

> 
> Thanks signo and JR. Very much appreciate your testing.

Unfortunately Sirine I don't have good news. I wasn't able to get your craft into orbit - once you get beyond about 50 m/s the drag just bogs you down too much... sorry.

JR

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-16T18:43:25Z" title="08/16/2015 06:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 16, 2015</time> by Jolly\_Roger**
